intro: Clinopodium hortense, commonly known as garden betony, is a perennial herb belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are often aromatic and have been used historically in herbal medicine. Clinopodium hortense is native to Europe and is cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties.
